page.title: 02Chelsfield Primary School
page.content: One hundred years ago Chelsfield Primary School served an area that stretched as far as Green Street Green and Pratts Bottom to the south,to Shoreham in the east and into Orpington and then out to Crockenhill. The pupils who attended this school stayed here until their formative education ceased at the age of 13 or so.They were crowded into 2 rooms and were segregated so that the boys and girl played in different yards and even had separate entrances and cloakrooms. However,during the past few years the Victorian surroundings have been altered and improved to provide more up to date accommodation.Inside the main building there are now 2 classrooms separated by an educational play area. One large class has been made into a dining and assembly area.Outside huts provide a class and resource room.
